title: Quick Gameplay Thoughts: May 19
body:
Morning all,

Smaller bits and pieces today. We should be in a spot where we can start talking about some of our plans for the rest of the year soon, for now we're still in mid-season followup time though.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Usual Disclaimers**

These posts will often contain talk about future work we're doing, or planning to do, that isn't yet guaranteed to ship. The nature of the work could change or, depending on what we discover, projects mentioned may get put delayed or even stopped.
If you'd like to see a Tweet whenever a new one of these posts goes up: https://twitter.com/RiotMeddler

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Zac**

Looks like we definitely overbuffed Zac in 7.10. We're looking at the best way to tone his power down at present, and figuring out just how out of line he is or isn't. Possible that happens in a hotfix, more likely 7.11 changes though unless we get a clear read on what exactly the biggest issue is and it looks urgent enough to not wait. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Guardian Angel**

We've been testing a nerf to GA on the PBE, exploring a approach where it's less effective on champions doing really well already (higher CD, CD reduced if you're dying repeatedly, thereby bringing the total number of 'deaths' it procs on somewhat closer for winning/losing teams). That's shown some promise, we're going to hold off on shipping it or other changes for now though. It's not clear enough GA's a problem, rather than just really popular but overrated. Planning to reassess for the next patch.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Icon Updates**

Should be a few more of these coming soon. Up next, Amumu and then, if memory serves Ahri. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Yasuo** 

Mid-season was kind to Yasuo, leaving him noticeably stronger. We're taking some power out in 7.11 as a result, reducing the duration he can hold his Q buff after hitting a target (both the initial buildup buff and the knockup buff). Some of that's reducing the duration Yasuo can threaten with the Q3. It's also intended to make Yasuo more dependent on allied knockups, making him a more or less attractive pick based off team comps. That's likely a direction we'll continue to investigate in future as well.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**L  e B l a n c**

We got back to looking at LB this patch. LB definitely needs work, she's been a problem since her update in pre-season. The changes we've been testing aren't hitting the mark at present however. We'll be looking at possible directions again next week. Apologies for ongoing lack of details on this one. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**15 minute unanimous surrender**

The early surrender option went out a few days ago in 7.10. We're seeing a bit of early friction around it in some games, based off the earlier test we ran in Oceania for a couple of months that's not unexpected. What we saw there was, after a settling down period, surrender rates before and after the introduction of the earlier option were unchanged. Effectively some games that would have been surrenders at 20 became surrenders at 15 instead. Other things we were measuring (afk rates, number of reports per game etc) didn't meaningfully change. We expect we'll see a similar trend in other regions, going to be keeping an eye on that though. If that's not the case would certainly be worth discussing adjustments (is this a feature that's a good fit for some regions but not others? Is 15 mins the correct time? Etc).

Off-topic 
But duplicate bans in the 10 ban system is going to result in wasted bans 
Resulting in player frustration

Yeah, I'd imagine there'll be some people who feel frustrated sometimes that they've ended up with a duplicate ban. We felt that was appropriate however for a couple of reasons:

1. This format gets through champ select quite a bit faster. We want to get people into game fairly quickly, given that's usually much more fun than champ select.

2. One of our goals with more bans was to give every player a guaranteed ban, increasing the amount of agency they have. We want the right compromise where everyone can remove something they don't want to play against every game, but people still have the best odds within that constraint of themselves getting to play what they do want. More agency, and more fairness based off position in champ select, are what we're aiming for, not more of the roster unavailable to play.

I understand that on a game-ish design level, but I'm still already frustrated. I wanted to see some "annoying" champions have 100% ban rate for a while so your various update teams feel forced to make them more fun to play against. Instead they'll have around 75% ban rate and everyone will just accept that that's the new normal high ban rate and the champions will stay as they are. There'll probably even be a new argument saying that it isn't so bad because you don't see those champions all that often (which makes the games you do play against them worse because you have less experience playing against them).

Neither of those reasons require duplicate bans being a thing.

Point 1 is the reason the bans are simultaneous.
Point 2 is rather ambiguous. It says that Riot wants to give more bans but doesn't want to reduce the available roster. This point contradicts with itself more than being a reason for duplicate bans. I understand that Riot is supporting player agency but the consequence is inherently fewer playable champions.
---
On the 10 bans announcement page, the reasoning given is that Riot wants to prevent bait-and-switch moments. A better remedy would be to require locking in or consider it a dodge.
---
**My proposition is that simultaneous banning is kept and both teams see any _locked in_ bans. Hovered bans don't get shown to the enemy team. However, players are required to lock in their bans.**
---
There can't be bait-and-switch moments if players don't show the ban until it's not changeable.

Hi, Meddler, hope you're doing well. 

I noticed some changes for Sion on the pbe, the one exciting me the most being the buff to the health scaling for his shield.

How likely is that change here to stay? Do you think Sion is in a good spot with it?

Thanks for your consideration.

Something like that's likely to stick around. It's part of a pass on a number of tanks that are struggling a bit post mid-season so need some adjustments (Mundo's another candidate, pretty sure we'll look at Malphite as well).

I was wondering if Riot has any plans for Leona?
I feel she has gotten shoved out of the way by a lot of other tanks so she never has a chance to shine (pun not intended)
Could something possibly be adding some other way she can contribute? Cause atm all she can do is just engage and standing around waiting for an opportunity to do so can be rather annoying. Plus, it would be nice if she could have an option to get herself out of a situation like some other tanks like Sej, Naut, and Zac for example.

Nothing at present. Leona's a pretty focused character - very initiation/lockdown heavy, all about when to go without much in the way of escape or allied protection. We think it's pretty valuable to have some champs like that, especially given how many champions are in the game now. Wouldn't want to push her towards being too similar to other tanks as a result.

All the more recent tank supports have some way to directly defend their ADC while she only has CC.

I would suggest a change, but I don't play Leona.

Leona is intended to be a vanguard, not a warden. Her focus isn't on protecting her team, but on setting up her allies to get kills. It's the difference between Malphite - who wants to initiate with his ult to set his team up for success - and Galio, who CAN start fights, but really just wants to keep his team's carries safe.

Sure, Malph and Leona CAN use their CC abilities to peel for their friends, but they're better off using them to start a fight.

The issue with Leona is that while she can start fights, her ability to win them is very limited.
If she dives without her teammates already approaching the fight, she's dead in the water. (Her E makes her go DEEP, making it both a blessing and a curse.)
If she DOES get followup, she'll get ignored since she doesn't really impact a fight outside of her long-cooldown single-target CC and early-game-only Sunlight procs.

Want to make her involved? Decrease the CD on her Q, double down on her ability to lock down the enemy carry and force the enemy team to focus her. Also, increase the damage on her Sunlight late game.

I believe that her lack of things to do in fights is why Riot gave her first three AAs after ulting bonus damage - that way she'd actually have something else to do in fights once she's gone in and blown her load. Reduced CD on the Q would be a fair buff though, makes it so that she still feels engaged.

I don't think that vanguards "win" fights, per se - Malphite, Sion, and other initiator tanks suffer from the same problem as Leona if they dive too deep for their team to follow. Nor should the tank be the one to "win" fights - unless they're landing a perfect five-man ultimate, it should be the carries that dictate how the rest of the fight proceeds (hence the name "carries" :P). Tanks just get the fight to start on the right foot.
